greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Fixed point of "n -> n/2 or (n-1)/2 until result is prime".
comment: a(n) is the largest prime whose binary expansion is an initial substring of n's binary expansion. - _Charlie Neder_, Oct 27 2018
a(1) = 1 by convention. - _David A. Corneth_, Oct 27 2018
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: ner[ n_Integer ] := FixedPoint[ If[ EvenQ[ # ]&&#>2, #/2, If[ PrimeQ[ # ]||(#=== 1), #, (#-1)/2 ] ]&, n, 20 ]
program: a039634 n = until ((== 1) . a010051) (flip div 2) n
(PARI) a(n)=while(n>3 && !isprime(n), n\=2); n \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jun 23 2017
results.author: _Wouter Meeussen_
